title: Drunk In Love (full version)
body:
Pairing: Bucky Barnes x reader

Warnings: Alcohol, cursing (just in case), EXTREME SAPPINESS

Word Count: 2,286

Summary: Loose lips sink ships… or do they?

A/N:There you go! Finally finished this lil thing, it turned out extremely sappy but what can a girl do? 

Also, please drink responsably, and don’t  confess your feelings inebriated… or do you never know 🤷‍♀️

Every inch of the tower was glistening. The low lighting, the candles, the chic décor, the live band- Stark really knew how to throw a party. The faces around the place were familiar- your fellow Avenger’s hard to miss, some agents and Stark employees acquaintances from missions and day-to-day work, yet the majority of the people were familiar in another way. Faces you’d seen on magazines, billboards, television, movies. Walking into the party you suddenly felt very aware of everything, specially everything that regarded yourself.

You had spent hours getting ready with Nat and Wanda, thankfully they were more skilled in knowing how to get ready for Tony’s get-togethers, and you were pleasantly surprised by the end result. The gown was beautiful, accentuating every single one of favourite features, the make up and hair more towards the vintage-y side, a look you had always wanted to try but never knew how-thank goodness for witches and super spies.

Looking at the faces of models, actors, politicians and literal gods your nerves started to get the best of you. Coming to a stop in mere seconds you turned around “I’m gonna need alcohol, like, a bucket of it.” Natasha gave you a mischievous smile, grabbing your hand and dragging you to the bar.

Turns out the Black Widow was quite the bartender and Scarlett Witch really knew how to hold her liquor… and Thor was a douchebag. After a few cocktails you were already feeling tipsy, carefully sat on the high stool, you watched as Wanda and Vision danced or rather tried.

“My lady, you look lovely tonight” A huge frame took the stool besides you and you rolled your eyes at his antics. Thor still wore his signature colours but instead of a cape he now incorporated it to a suit- dark red combo with little golden patterns of what you imagined to be some sort of Asgardian runes.

“Thank you, my lord.” You offered with a small giggle “Enjoying the middle-gardian’s festivities I see.”

“Midgardian”

“Same difference”

“And yes, I am, but not nearly drunk enough to keep up with Tony’s… friends.” He eyed the bartender ordering drinks as your eyes scanned the room. The spot you had avoided the whole night suddenly catching your attention.

The pool table was surrounded by people- man and women with seductive smiles and hunting eyes- watching the people playing. The Bird Clique, Clint and Sam, played against The American Geriatric Duo, Steve and Bucky. Your smile was instantaneous, the four idiot’s bickering amusing to watch even from afar.

Blue eyes focused on you, a smile spreading on both your faces. You let your eyes linger on the man for the first time that night: broad shoulders covered by an obscenely well tailored suit, top buttons of his shirt undone, his hair was slicked back providing a perfect view of his face as he leaned against his pool stick. Bucky eyed you with the same curiosity, making a shiver run down your spine as his eyes came back to yours. With a raised brow and a nod he silently complimented your look.

“So… can you keep up?” Your attention snapped back to the god besides you, Thor looked at you with a defying grin on his lips. Eight shots lined the bar, you frowned, knowing exactly where this was going. “Or are you already running out of midgardian stamina? I mean, I can’t blame you, you’re badass but only human…”

You knocked back four of the ridiculously strong shots. Jesus, Tony, what the hell even is on these? Thor’s thunderous laugh filled the air, taking the little flask from his pocket he mixed  Asgardian liquor into the remaining shots and downed them.

Around the room the other Avengers watched the two of you, slightly shaking their heads.  

~

A few hours later you were still on the dance floor, amongst some of your teammates and a few strangers. Insecurities long gone, taking your filters with it. Deciding to take a break you walked back to the bar, sipping your water you smiled at the scene: your friends on the dance floor- it was good to see them like this, happy and silly, forgetting for at least a few hours the weight on their shoulders.

For the hundredth time that night your eyes searched for the long haired super-soldier. He sat in one of the couches on the second floor, you blatantly stared at him, taking advantage of the fact he couldn’t see you. He was beautiful, blue eyes shinning even from this distance. His jacket was long gone, sleeves pushed up letting his arm glisten in the low lighting, he’d undone a few more buttons of his shirt- your mouth watered at the sight of him.

Barnes was hot, there was no denying that, but what made your heart stop was when he threw his head back laughing at something Sam said. It was something that was becoming more and more often as the ex-assassin got used to his new life- laughter and happiness taking over the parts of his life that were formerly occupied by screams and oblivion.

It was easy to want him, bulging muscles and handsome features. But it was even easier to fall for him, for his mannerisms, his laugh, his compassion, his care. Everything he was worked like gravity and you were falling fast.

You bit your lip, pondering your options, you could do something about your feelings now while your veins were filled with liquid courage or you could keep loving him from afar, never knowing what his response would be. Digging the phone out of your purse you took a deep breath, fingers shaky. I need you.

As you hit send your brain instantly went haywire, imagining every single scenario possible. You watched as he pulled out his phone, a frown taking over his features as he typed. Are you okay? Did something happen? How can I help?

His eyes scanned the room, a bit frantic, a deep line forming between his brows. A laugh erupted from your throat. Can you be any more adorable? Well, it was now or never. No, Buck. I want you. Have wanted you since the day we met.

Bucky’s eyes went back to the phone, mouth slightly agape as he read your message. Again his eyes searched the party, an unreadable expression on his face. Until his eyes finally found you. It burned and you had to look away or you were sure you’d combust.

He almost tripped on his way down the stairs, but he wasn’t headed towards the bar, he went straight to the dance floor, seeking someone else. Thor’s liquor burned on the way down his throat but the feeling was welcomed- he was gonna need it if he intended to have this talk with you.

Blue eyes snapped to the bar, the empty stool making his heart beat out of control.

~

The common area was empty and you threw yourself on the soft couch, instantly regretting it as your drunken body reacted to the harsh motion. Humming in discontent you cursed under your breath. All this time… all this time you manage to hide your feelings and now because you can’t hold your liquor you open your mouth. Great job, Y/N. Way to make things weird.

The image of Bucky descending the stairs and going away from you replayed in your head, the memory of his unreadable expression dancing in your mind. You felt ashamed and foolish, wishing with every part of your being that you could take your words back. Dealing with him never knowing was so much easier then dealing with rejection, and with the awkwardness that was bound to settle between the two of you.

Heels hit the floor at the same time as you buried your face in one of the cushions, longing for it to swallow you. Stupid. Stupid. Stupid.

Bucky frantically scanned the place, but you weren’t there. His hands were shaking- even the metal one, something he didn’t know it could do- and his mouth was dry. The other worldly alcohol was slowing him down as he searched- his mind seemed to work too fast and his body too slow. Every single scenario played in his head- it was a prank, you didn’t mean it, you regretted it. He went to your room but either you weren’t there or you didn’t want to see him. He didn’t know where else to look or even if you was still on the tower. Slightly wobbly legs led him through the corridors, no plan in sight, just trying to process all the information as he poorly looked around. I’m an idiot, I should have told her sooner. A hundred years old and still needing alcohol to talk to a pretty girl. Nice job, Barnes.

A strain of muffled curses reached his ears. Stopping dead on his track Bucky looked over to the common area, he couldn’t help the laugh from bubbling up his chest. The dress looked like a mess bundled up around your body-cloth flowing to the floor where your heels were thrown. You were face first on the cushion, hair everywhere, limbs stretched out beside your body. Curses barely audible, if it was not for the enhanced hearing he might not have heard it.

Something inside Bucky’s chest twisted, endearment washing over him, his heart rapidly pumping alcohol dosed blood through his veins. He felt nothing but love. And for some reason all that came out in the form of laughter.

You shot up at the sound, almost falling off the couch. The audacity of Bucky Barnes, looking so good standing there, shoulders shaking as he laughed his ass off. For some reason you didn’t feel offended, somehow you knew he wasn’t laughing at you, his teary eyes were fixed on you but they conveyed something much deeper then mirth.

If anyone saw that scene they would be sure both of you were crazy, you on the couch clutching your aching belly and the super soldier on the other side of the room tears in his eyes as you guffawed at each other. After several minutes you managed to compose yourselves, gazes locked- blue eyes now filled with a mirthful tears and burning with fierce intent.

“I want you too” His voice was low but the weight of his words hit you like a banshee scream “I think I wanted you before we met. Hell, I might have longed for you before you were even born, when Steve was a scrawny punk and I was an idiot looking for love in anything that wore a skirt.”

He crossed the room with large hurried steps, sitting across from you on the couch. “And it only took me months of silent pinning and half a bottle of Thor’s magic liquor for me to finally tell you.” You were burning up, a mixture of flushed cheeks and pure adoration for men in front of you.

A teasing smile crossed your lips “Who knew drunk Bucky was so sappy?” He mocked offence, a hand across his chest. “Me? Sappy?” He practically crawled his way to you on the couch, dangerous eyes locked on yours. Your mind shot down completely as his arms caged you against the couch, lips hovering over yours. “For you, always.”

And just like that he kissed you, a slow tender kiss that conveyed so much emotion that you almost passed out. Everything felt soft and warm and comforting and you never wished so hard you didn’t need oxygen. Eventually the kiss stopped, Bucky leaned his forehead on yours, eyes closed and a giant grin on his lips.

It might have been the dizziness of the alcohol or of the kiss, it might have been the way he looked at you or the soft kisses he pressed against your skin, it might have been the way his hands felt so right around yours or the way he poured his heart out to you. But it might have been the fact that it was the simple truth. “I think I’m in love with you” The words flowed out your mouth before you could think about it, because you only felt it.

Metal fingers cupped your cheek, Bucky’s eyes were wide and the smile he nurtured grew even bigger. He punctuated his words with soft kisses “I. Love. You.” Maybe it was too soon, but for him it was a lifetime of waiting and he was not going to let another second pass without letting you know. The smile you gave him was worth all the time.

~

The flashing light woke you up with a groan, big arms grew tighter around your body. Slowly you opened your eyes and were met with several stares. “About time, you two.” Steve’s broad smile was blinding, almost as blinding as the flashing of phones as the other Avengers took pictures.

You and Bucky had fallen asleep on the couch, still in your formal clothes, in each others arms, after several make out sessions. Old blue eyes searched your face a proud smile on his soft plump lips. “Fuck off, Steve.” Was all he said before grabbing your hand and leading you out of the room.

A choir of mocking reprimands to Bucky’s language could be heard from the hallway, both of you laughing while making your escape. The laughter died in your throat as Natasha’s high voice reached your ears “Hey, and don’t forget to use protection!”

Your face was burning hot as Bucky came to a halt, turning around to face you a mischievous smirk on his handsome face and a promising wink before he pulled you into his room.

Thanks for reading! Please let me know if you liked it ! Also, excuse any mistakes, English is not my first language. 

Tags: @sassymissmyra @hellyeahbarnes @satans-knitting-club @lesbiiionest @forsaken-letters @iheartsebastianstan (sorry this took longer then expected so tagged everyone that was so sweet to me 😬)

The gown was beautiful, accentuating every single one of favourite features, the make up and hair more towards the vintage-y side, a look you had always wanted to try but never knew how-thank goodness for witches and super spies.

Looking at the faces of models, actors, politicians and literal gods your nerves started to get the best of you. Coming to a stop in mere seconds you turned around “I’m gonna need alcohol, like, a bucket of it.” Natasha gave you a mischievous smile, grabbing your hand and dragging you to the bar.

Turns out the Black Widow was quite the bartender and Scarlett Witch really knew how to hold her liquor… and Thor was a douchebag. After a few cocktails you were already feeling tipsy, carefully sat on the high stool, you watched as Wanda and Vision danced or rather tried.

reblog.comment:
Pairing: Bucky Barnes x reader

Warnings: Alcohol, cursing (just in case), EXTREME SAPPINESS

Word Count: 2,286

Summary: Loose lips sink ships… or do they?

A/N:There you go! Finally finished this lil thing, it turned out extremely sappy but what can a girl do? 

Also, please drink responsably, and don’t  confess your feelings inebriated… or do you never know 🤷‍♀️

Every inch of the tower was glistening. The low lighting, the candles, the chic décor, the live band- Stark really knew how to throw a party. The faces around the place were familiar- your fellow Avenger’s hard to miss, some agents and Stark employees acquaintances from missions and day-to-day work, yet the majority of the people were familiar in another way. Faces you’d seen on magazines, billboards, television, movies. Walking into the party you suddenly felt very aware of everything, specially everything that regarded yourself.

You had spent hours getting ready with Nat and Wanda, thankfully they were more skilled in knowing how to get ready for Tony’s get-togethers, and you were pleasantly surprised by the end result. The gown was beautiful, accentuating every single one of favourite features, the make up and hair more towards the vintage-y side, a look you had always wanted to try but never knew how-thank goodness for witches and super spies.

Looking at the faces of models, actors, politicians and literal gods your nerves started to get the best of you. Coming to a stop in mere seconds you turned around “I’m gonna need alcohol, like, a bucket of it.” Natasha gave you a mischievous smile, grabbing your hand and dragging you to the bar.

Turns out the Black Widow was quite the bartender and Scarlett Witch really knew how to hold her liquor… and Thor was a douchebag. After a few cocktails you were already feeling tipsy, carefully sat on the high stool, you watched as Wanda and Vision danced or rather tried.

[[MORE]]

“My lady, you look lovely tonight” A huge frame took the stool besides you and you rolled your eyes at his antics. Thor still wore his signature colours but instead of a cape he now incorporated it to a suit- dark red combo with little golden patterns of what you imagined to be some sort of Asgardian runes.

“Thank you, my lord.” You offered with a small giggle “Enjoying the middle-gardian’s festivities I see.”

“Midgardian”

“Same difference”

“And yes, I am, but not nearly drunk enough to keep up with Tony’s… friends.” He eyed the bartender ordering drinks as your eyes scanned the room. The spot you had avoided the whole night suddenly catching your attention.

The pool table was surrounded by people- man and women with seductive smiles and hunting eyes- watching the people playing. The Bird Clique, Clint and Sam, played against The American Geriatric Duo, Steve and Bucky. Your smile was instantaneous, the four idiot’s bickering amusing to watch even from afar.

Blue eyes focused on you, a smile spreading on both your faces. You let your eyes linger on the man for the first time that night: broad shoulders covered by an obscenely well tailored suit, top buttons of his shirt undone, his hair was slicked back providing a perfect view of his face as he leaned against his pool stick. Bucky eyed you with the same curiosity, making a shiver run down your spine as his eyes came back to yours. With a raised brow and a nod he silently complimented your look.

“So… can you keep up?” Your attention snapped back to the god besides you, Thor looked at you with a defying grin on his lips. Eight shots lined the bar, you frowned, knowing exactly where this was going. “Or are you already running out of midgardian stamina? I mean, I can’t blame you, you’re badass but only human…”

You knocked back four of the ridiculously strong shots. Jesus, Tony, what the hell even is on these? Thor’s thunderous laugh filled the air, taking the little flask from his pocket he mixed  Asgardian liquor into the remaining shots and downed them.

Around the room the other Avengers watched the two of you, slightly shaking their heads.  

~

A few hours later you were still on the dance floor, amongst some of your teammates and a few strangers. Insecurities long gone, taking your filters with it. Deciding to take a break you walked back to the bar, sipping your water you smiled at the scene: your friends on the dance floor- it was good to see them like this, happy and silly, forgetting for at least a few hours the weight on their shoulders.

For the hundredth time that night your eyes searched for the long haired super-soldier. He sat in one of the couches on the second floor, you blatantly stared at him, taking advantage of the fact he couldn’t see you. He was beautiful, blue eyes shinning even from this distance. His jacket was long gone, sleeves pushed up letting his arm glisten in the low lighting, he’d undone a few more buttons of his shirt- your mouth watered at the sight of him.

Barnes was hot, there was no denying that, but what made your heart stop was when he threw his head back laughing at something Sam said. It was something that was becoming more and more often as the ex-assassin got used to his new life- laughter and happiness taking over the parts of his life that were formerly occupied by screams and oblivion.

It was easy to want him, bulging muscles and handsome features. But it was even easier to fall for him, for his mannerisms, his laugh, his compassion, his care. Everything he was worked like gravity and you were falling fast.

You bit your lip, pondering your options, you could do something about your feelings now while your veins were filled with liquid courage or you could keep loving him from afar, never knowing what his response would be. Digging the phone out of your purse you took a deep breath, fingers shaky. I need you.

As you hit send your brain instantly went haywire, imagining every single scenario possible. You watched as he pulled out his phone, a frown taking over his features as he typed. Are you okay? Did something happen? How can I help?

His eyes scanned the room, a bit frantic, a deep line forming between his brows. A laugh erupted from your throat. Can you be any more adorable? Well, it was now or never. No, Buck. I want you. Have wanted you since the day we met.

Bucky’s eyes went back to the phone, mouth slightly agape as he read your message. Again his eyes searched the party, an unreadable expression on his face. Until his eyes finally found you. It burned and you had to look away or you were sure you’d combust.

He almost tripped on his way down the stairs, but he wasn’t headed towards the bar, he went straight to the dance floor, seeking someone else. Thor’s liquor burned on the way down his throat but the feeling was welcomed- he was gonna need it if he intended to have this talk with you.

Blue eyes snapped to the bar, the empty stool making his heart beat out of control.

~

The common area was empty and you threw yourself on the soft couch, instantly regretting it as your drunken body reacted to the harsh motion. Humming in discontent you cursed under your breath. All this time… all this time you manage to hide your feelings and now because you can’t hold your liquor you open your mouth. Great job, Y/N. Way to make things weird.

The image of Bucky descending the stairs and going away from you replayed in your head, the memory of his unreadable expression dancing in your mind. You felt ashamed and foolish, wishing with every part of your being that you could take your words back. Dealing with him never knowing was so much easier then dealing with rejection, and with the awkwardness that was bound to settle between the two of you.

Heels hit the floor at the same time as you buried your face in one of the cushions, longing for it to swallow you. Stupid. Stupid. Stupid.

Bucky frantically scanned the place, but you weren’t there. His hands were shaking- even the metal one, something he didn’t know it could do- and his mouth was dry. The other worldly alcohol was slowing him down as he searched- his mind seemed to work too fast and his body too slow. Every single scenario played in his head- it was a prank, you didn’t mean it, you regretted it. He went to your room but either you weren’t there or you didn’t want to see him. He didn’t know where else to look or even if you was still on the tower. Slightly wobbly legs led him through the corridors, no plan in sight, just trying to process all the information as he poorly looked around. I’m an idiot, I should have told her sooner. A hundred years old and still needing alcohol to talk to a pretty girl. Nice job, Barnes.

A strain of muffled curses reached his ears. Stopping dead on his track Bucky looked over to the common area, he couldn’t help the laugh from bubbling up his chest. The dress looked like a mess bundled up around your body-cloth flowing to the floor where your heels were thrown. You were face first on the cushion, hair everywhere, limbs stretched out beside your body. Curses barely audible, if it was not for the enhanced hearing he might not have heard it.

Something inside Bucky’s chest twisted, endearment washing over him, his heart rapidly pumping alcohol dosed blood through his veins. He felt nothing but love. And for some reason all that came out in the form of laughter.

You shot up at the sound, almost falling off the couch. The audacity of Bucky Barnes, looking so good standing there, shoulders shaking as he laughed his ass off. For some reason you didn’t feel offended, somehow you knew he wasn’t laughing at you, his teary eyes were fixed on you but they conveyed something much deeper then mirth.

If anyone saw that scene they would be sure both of you were crazy, you on the couch clutching your aching belly and the super soldier on the other side of the room tears in his eyes as you guffawed at each other. After several minutes you managed to compose yourselves, gazes locked- blue eyes now filled with a mirthful tears and burning with fierce intent.

“I want you too” His voice was low but the weight of his words hit you like a banshee scream “I think I wanted you before we met. Hell, I might have longed for you before you were even born, when Steve was a scrawny punk and I was an idiot looking for love in anything that wore a skirt.”

He crossed the room with large hurried steps, sitting across from you on the couch. “And it only took me months of silent pinning and half a bottle of Thor’s magic liquor for me to finally tell you.” You were burning up, a mixture of flushed cheeks and pure adoration for men in front of you.

A teasing smile crossed your lips “Who knew drunk Bucky was so sappy?” He mocked offence, a hand across his chest. “Me? Sappy?” He practically crawled his way to you on the couch, dangerous eyes locked on yours. Your mind shot down completely as his arms caged you against the couch, lips hovering over yours. “For you, always.”

And just like that he kissed you, a slow tender kiss that conveyed so much emotion that you almost passed out. Everything felt soft and warm and comforting and you never wished so hard you didn’t need oxygen. Eventually the kiss stopped, Bucky leaned his forehead on yours, eyes closed and a giant grin on his lips.

It might have been the dizziness of the alcohol or of the kiss, it might have been the way he looked at you or the soft kisses he pressed against your skin, it might have been the way his hands felt so right around yours or the way he poured his heart out to you. But it might have been the fact that it was the simple truth. “I think I’m in love with you” The words flowed out your mouth before you could think about it, because you only felt it.

Metal fingers cupped your cheek, Bucky’s eyes were wide and the smile he nurtured grew even bigger. He punctuated his words with soft kisses “I. Love. You.” Maybe it was too soon, but for him it was a lifetime of waiting and he was not going to let another second pass without letting you know. The smile you gave him was worth all the time.

~

The flashing light woke you up with a groan, big arms grew tighter around your body. Slowly you opened your eyes and were met with several stares. “About time, you two.” Steve’s broad smile was blinding, almost as blinding as the flashing of phones as the other Avengers took pictures.

You and Bucky had fallen asleep on the couch, still in your formal clothes, in each others arms, after several make out sessions. Old blue eyes searched your face a proud smile on his soft plump lips. “Fuck off, Steve.” Was all he said before grabbing your hand and leading you out of the room.

A choir of mocking reprimands to Bucky’s language could be heard from the hallway, both of you laughing while making your escape. The laughter died in your throat as Natasha’s high voice reached your ears “Hey, and don’t forget to use protection!”

Your face was burning hot as Bucky came to a halt, turning around to face you a mischievous smirk on his handsome face and a promising wink before he pulled you into his room.

Thanks for reading! Please let me know if you liked it ! Also, excuse any mistakes, English is not my first language. 

Tags: @sassymissmyra @hellyeahbarnes @satans-knitting-club @lesbiiionest @forsaken-letters @iheartsebastianstan (sorry this took longer then expected so tagged everyone that was so sweet to me 😬)

Digging the phone out of your purse you took a deep breath, fingers shaky. I need you.

As you hit send your brain instantly went haywire, imagining every single scenario possible. You watched as he pulled out his phone, a frown taking over his features as he typed. Are you okay? Did something happen? How can I help?

His eyes scanned the room, a bit frantic, a deep line forming between his brows. A laugh erupted from your throat. Can you be any more adorable? Well, it was now or never. No, Buck. I want you. Have wanted you since the day we met.

Bucky’s eyes went back to the phone, mouth slightly agape as he read your message. Again his eyes searched the party, an unreadable expression on his face. Until his eyes finally found you. It burned and you had to look away or you were sure you’d combust.

He almost tripped on his way down the stairs, but he wasn’t headed towards the bar, he went straight to the dance floor, seeking someone else. Thor’s liquor burned on the way down his throat but the feeling was welcomed- he was gonna need it if he intended to have this talk with you.

Blue eyes snapped to the bar, the empty stool making his heart beat out of control.

~

The common area was empty and you threw yourself on the soft couch, instantly regretting it as your drunken body reacted to the harsh motion. Humming in discontent you cursed under your breath. All this time… all this time you manage to hide your feelings and now because you can’t hold your liquor you open your mouth. Great job, Y/N. Way to make things weird.

The image of Bucky descending the stairs and going away from you replayed in your head, the memory of his unreadable expression dancing in your mind. You felt ashamed and foolish, wishing with every part of your being that you could take your words back. Dealing with him never knowing was so much easier then dealing with rejection, and with the awkwardness that was bound to settle between the two of you.

Heels hit the floor at the same time as you buried your face in one of the cushions, longing for it to swallow you. Stupid. Stupid. Stupid.

Bucky frantically scanned the place, but you weren’t there. His hands were shaking- even the metal one, something he didn’t know it could do- and his mouth was dry. The other worldly alcohol was slowing him down as he searched- his mind seemed to work too fast and his body too slow. Every single scenario played in his head- it was a prank, you didn’t mean it, you regretted it. He went to your room but either you weren’t there or you didn’t want to see him. He didn’t know where else to look or even if you was still on the tower. Slightly wobbly legs led him through the corridors, no plan in sight, just trying to process all the information as he poorly looked around. I’m an idiot, I should have told her sooner. A hundred years old and still needing alcohol to talk to a pretty girl. Nice job, Barnes.

A strain of muffled curses reached his ears. Stopping dead on his track Bucky looked over to the common area, he couldn’t help the laugh from bubbling up his chest. The dress looked like a mess bundled up around your body-cloth flowing to the floor where your heels were thrown. You were face first on the cushion, hair everywhere, limbs stretched out beside your body. Curses barely audible, if it was not for the enhanced hearing he might not have heard it.

Something inside Bucky’s chest twisted, endearment washing over him, his heart rapidly pumping alcohol dosed blood through his veins. He felt nothing but love. And for some reason all that came out in the form of laughter.

You shot up at the sound, almost falling off the couch. The audacity of Bucky Barnes, looking so good standing there, shoulders shaking as he laughed his ass off. For some reason you didn’t feel offended, somehow you knew he wasn’t laughing at you, his teary eyes were fixed on you but they conveyed something much deeper then mirth.

If anyone saw that scene they would be sure both of you were crazy, you on the couch clutching your aching belly and the super soldier on the other side of the room tears in his eyes as you guffawed at each other. After several minutes you managed to compose yourselves, gazes locked- blue eyes now filled with a mirthful tears and burning with fierce intent.

“I want you too” His voice was low but the weight of his words hit you like a banshee scream “I think I wanted you before we met. Hell, I might have longed for you before you were even born, when Steve was a scrawny punk and I was an idiot looking for love in anything that wore a skirt.”

He crossed the room with large hurried steps, sitting across from you on the couch. “And it only took me months of silent pinning and half a bottle of Thor’s magic liquor for me to finally tell you.” You were burning up, a mixture of flushed cheeks and pure adoration for men in front of you.

A teasing smile crossed your lips “Who knew drunk Bucky was so sappy?” He mocked offence, a hand across his chest. “Me? Sappy?” He practically crawled his way to you on the couch, dangerous eyes locked on yours. Your mind shot down completely as his arms caged you against the couch, lips hovering over yours. “For you, always.”

And just like that he kissed you, a slow tender kiss that conveyed so much emotion that you almost passed out. Everything felt soft and warm and comforting and you never wished so hard you didn’t need oxygen. Eventually the kiss stopped, Bucky leaned his forehead on yours, eyes closed and a giant grin on his lips.

It might have been the dizziness of the alcohol or of the kiss, it might have been the way he looked at you or the soft kisses he pressed against your skin, it might have been the way his hands felt so right around yours or the way he poured his heart out to you. But it might have been the fact that it was the simple truth. “I think I’m in love with you” The words flowed out your mouth before you could think about it, because you only felt it.

Metal fingers cupped your cheek, Bucky’s eyes were wide and the smile he nurtured grew even bigger. He punctuated his words with soft kisses “I. Love. You.” Maybe it was too soon, but for him it was a lifetime of waiting and he was not going to let another second pass without letting you know. The smile you gave him was worth all the time.

~

The flashing light woke you up with a groan, big arms grew tighter around your body. Slowly you opened your eyes and were met with several stares. “About time, you two.” Steve’s broad smile was blinding, almost as blinding as the flashing of phones as the other Avengers took pictures.

You and Bucky had fallen asleep on the couch, still in your formal clothes, in each others arms, after several make out sessions. Old blue eyes searched your face a proud smile on his soft plump lips. “Fuck off, Steve.” Was all he said before grabbing your hand and leading you out of the room.

A choir of mocking reprimands to Bucky’s language could be heard from the hallway, both of you laughing while making your escape. The laughter died in your throat as Natasha’s high voice reached your ears “Hey, and don’t forget to use protection!”

Your face was burning hot as Bucky came to a halt, turning around to face you a mischievous smirk on his handsome face and a promising wink before he pulled you into his room.

Thanks for reading! Please let me know if you liked it ! Also, excuse any mistakes, English is not my first language. 

Tags: @sassymissmyra @hellyeahbarnes @satans-knitting-club @lesbiiionest @forsaken-letters @iheartsebastianstan (sorry this took longer then expected so tagged everyone that was so sweet to me 😬)
trail.content_abstract:
Pairing: Bucky Barnes x reader

Warnings: Alcohol, cursing (just in case), EXTREME SAPPINESS

Word Count: 2,286

Summary: Loose lips sink ships… or do they?

A/N:There you go! Finally finished this lil thing, it turned out extremely sappy but what can a girl do? 

Also, please drink responsably, and don’t  confess your feelings inebriated… or do you never know 🤷‍♀️

Every inch of the tower was glistening. The low lighting, the candles, the chic décor, the live band- Stark really knew how to throw a party. The faces around the place were familiar- your fellow Avenger’s hard to miss, some agents and Stark employees acquaintances from missions and day-to-day work, yet the majority of the people were familiar in another way. Faces you’d seen on magazines, billboards, television, movies. Walking into the party you suddenly felt very aware of everything, specially everything that regarded yourself.

You had spent hours getting ready with Nat and Wanda, thankfully they were more skilled in knowing how to get ready for Tony’s get-togethers, and you were pleasantly surprised by the end result. The gown was beautiful, accentuating every single one of favourite features, the make up and hair more towards the vintage-y side, a look you had always wanted to try but never knew how-thank goodness for witches and super spies.

Looking at the faces of models, actors, politicians and literal gods your nerves started to get the best of you. Coming to a stop in mere seconds you turned around “I’m gonna need alcohol, like, a bucket of it.” Natasha gave you a mischievous smile, grabbing your hand and dragging you to the bar.

Turns out the Black Widow was quite the bartender and Scarlett Witch really knew how to hold her liquor… and Thor was a douchebag. After a few cocktails you were already feeling tipsy, carefully sat on the high stool, you watched as Wanda and Vision danced or rather tried.

body: Alright, peeps! The time has come. I wish I could say I’m gonna avoid going online altogether but I would be lying. I will be limiting my time on the internet by a lot. Like a lot. With Endgame and the Battle of Winterfell coming, I want to experience it without spoilers. I won’t be around much. I’ll probably be back Thursday night after I watch Endgame to post my reaction (without the spoilers). Let’s enjoy it and cry about it. See you on the other side!

summary: Who are you favorite Marvel Characters? Also my favorite is Steve I just love him a lot you know? And are you going to see...
question: Who are you favorite Marvel Characters? Also my favorite is Steve I just love him a lot you know? And are you going to see Endgame this weekend?
answer:
Of the OG characters, my forever live has always been Steve. But after Ragnorak I am here to suppprt Thor as well. Those two are my loves. I adore Black Widow but I don’t love what they continue to do to her in the MCU.

From the newer kids: Wanda, Vision, Rocket/Groot, and Okoye.

I do plan to see Endgame this weekend I’m just not sure when exactly! I want to go to like the first show in the morning tbh. I’m taking Monday off to heal from the emotional stress of GoT and Endgame so I might go Monday morning?? Idk.
